page.title: 01EGREMONT AREA TITLE PAGE
page.content: Egremont is three miles from the Irish sea and covers the S.W. 4KM. The river Ehen runs down the Ehen valley ,from Ennerdale lake, through Egremont and finishes at sellafield. The N.E. corner is the start of the Lakeland fells, with Dent fell riseing from 150-1131 feet. The bottom S.E.& S squares contain the working iron ore mine. Iron ore has been mined for 800yrs from 9 mines in the area. Egremont was built up around the 12th centuary castle. The castle was built by William Demeschines. In 1267 Henry 3rd granted a charter allowing Egremont 1 weekly market and 1 three day fair. Egremont contains 6 industries manufacturing different products. It has expanded to accomodate the Sellafield power plant and as a consequence a new by-pass is planned.
